paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper discusses pathogenic mutations in the TTR gene, specifically V30M, R34T, and K35T, and their effects on TTR aggregation and amyloid formation.

functional_data.summary: The V30M mutation accelerates the process of liquid-to-solid phase transition and facilitates the formation of fibrillary aggregates.

variants.additional_notes: The V30M mutation is the most common mutation in familial amyloid polyneuropathy.
key_quotes: The V30M mutation was the most common mutation in FAP.
mutants accelerated the process of liquid-to-solid phase transition.

functional_data.summary: The R34T mutation also accelerates the process of liquid-to-solid phase transition.

variants.additional_notes: The R34T mutation caused vitreous amyloidosis.
key_quotes: The R34T mutation caused vitreous amyloidosis.
mutants accelerated the process of liquid-to-solid phase transition.

functional_data.summary: The K35T mutation forms more amyloid fibrils than the other two mutants.

variants.additional_notes: The K35T mutation was identified in patients with amyloid polyneuropathy and restrictive cardiomyopathy.
key_quotes: The K35T mutation was identified in patients with amyloid polyneuropathy and restrictive cardiomyopathy.
K35T formed more amyloid fibrils than the other two mutants.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant variants in the TTR gene were extracted successfully.
